body_html:
Have the same issue when importing tensorflow (only fails with tensorflow-gpu):

tf_gpu) [---@---:/home/...]% python3
Python 3.6.5 (default, Apr  1 2018, 05:46:30) 
[GCC 7.3.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow
python3: Relink `/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libudev.so.1' with `/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so.1' for IFUNC symbol `clock_gettime'
zsh: segmentation fault (core dumped)  python3

Some info about my setup:

  1. CUDA toolkit 9.0
  2. set the PATH and LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variables as suggested
  3. Installed nvidia drivers using ubuntu-drivers autoinstall
  4. Installed opencv-python and np_utils as suggested

body:
Have the same issue when importing tensorflow (only fails with tensorflow-gpu):

```
tf_gpu) [---@---:/home/...]% python3
Python 3.6.5 (default, Apr  1 2018, 05:46:30) 
[GCC 7.3.0] on linux
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import tensorflow
python3: Relink `/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libudev.so.1' with `/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/librt.so.1' for IFUNC symbol `clock_gettime'
zsh: segmentation fault (core dumped)  python3

```

Some info about my setup:
1. CUDA toolkit 9.0
2. set the PATH and LD_LIBRARY_PATH environment variables as suggested
3. Installed nvidia drivers using ```ubuntu-drivers autoinstall```
4. Installed ```opencv-python``` and ```np_utils``` as suggested
